properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.access-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Access Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.bedrock-agent-runtime-client
properties.description: To use an existing configured AWS Bedrock Agent Runtime client. The option is a software.amazon.awssdk.services.bedrockagentruntime.BedrockAgentRuntimeClient type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.configuration
properties.description: Component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.aws2.bedrock.agentruntime.BedrockAgentRuntimeConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the aws-bedrock-agent-runtime component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.health-check-consumer-enabled
properties.description: Used for enabling or disabling all consumer based health checks from this component

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.health-check-producer-enabled
properties.description: Used for enabling or disabling all producer based health checks from this component. Notice: Camel has by default disabled all producer based health-checks. You can turn on producer checks globally by setting camel.health.producersEnabled=true.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.knowledge-base-id
properties.description: Define the Knowledge Base Id we are going to use

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.model-id
properties.description: Define the model Id we are going to use

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.operation
properties.description: The operation to perform

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.override-endpoint
properties.description: Set the need for overriding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with the uriEndpointOverride option

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.pojo-request
properties.description: If we want to use a POJO request as body or not

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.profile-credentials-name
properties.description: If using a profile credentials provider, this parameter will set the profile name

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.proxy-host
properties.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the Bedrock Agent Runtime client

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.proxy-port
properties.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the Bedrock Agent Runtime client

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.proxy-protocol
properties.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the Bedrock Agent Runtime client

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.region
properties.description: The region in which Bedrock Agent Runtime client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example, ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.secret-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Secret Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.session-token
properties.description: Amazon AWS Session Token used when the user needs to assume an IAM role

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.trust-all-certificates
properties.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.uri-endpoint-override
properties.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.use-default-credentials-provider
properties.description: Set whether the Bedrock Agent Runtime client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.use-profile-credentials-provider
properties.description: Set whether the Bedrock Agent Runtime client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime.use-session-credentials
properties.description: Set whether the Bedrock Agent Runtime client should expect to use Session Credentials. This is useful in a situation in which the user needs to assume an IAM role for doing operations in Bedrock.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent.access-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Access Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent.bedrock-agent-client
properties.description: To use an existing configured AWS Bedrock Agent client. The option is a software.amazon.awssdk.services.bedrockagent.BedrockAgentClient type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions (if possible) occurred while the Camel consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. Important: This is only possible if the 3rd party component allows Camel to be alerted if an exception was thrown. Some components handle this internally only, and therefore bridgeErrorHandler is not possible. In other situations we may improve the Camel component to hook into the 3rd party component and make this possible for future releases. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent.configuration
properties.description: Component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.aws2.bedrock.agent.BedrockAgentConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent.data-source-id
properties.description: Define the Data source Id we are going to use

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the aws-bedrock-agent component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent.health-check-consumer-enabled
properties.description: Used for enabling or disabling all consumer based health checks from this component

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent.health-check-producer-enabled
properties.description: Used for enabling or disabling all producer based health checks from this component. Notice: Camel has by default disabled all producer based health-checks. You can turn on producer checks globally by setting camel.health.producersEnabled=true.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent.ingestion-job-id
properties.description: Define the Ingestion Job Id we want to track

properties.name: camel.component.aws-bedrock-agent.knowledge-base-id

By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
